reviews.review: Since I have no one to play with in the past 5 years because of being shunned by a "christian" clan.....this game is great to play.  No need to have people on your friends list to form a team.  No need to talk to anyone in this game because there is no in-game voice or text chat.  But yet people help you and you can help others in this game.  At times the game is scary as hell...I like that very much.  Perfect game for a lone ranger.

Dead by Daylight can be a fun and addictive game but unfortunately, it also has the most toxic community I have ever encountered on the Internet. You will never be able to go more than one hour without someone being horrible to you, regardless of whether you are playing survivor or killer. Save yourself the stress and stay away.

PS4と合わせて約800時間ほどプレイしました。また、キラーとサバイバーともに最高ランクである1まで達しての感想です。結論から言うと、ただのサバイバーに有利な1対4のゲームです。昔に比べてキラーはことごとく弱くなる一方で、サバイバーはひたすらに強化を繰り返されています。現在のマッチはキラーが圧倒的に過疎であり、その要因を考えれば当然の結果です。ゲームそのものは面白いので、サバイバーでキラーをぼこぼこにする快感を得たい人にはプレイをお勧めします。

As you can see, I currently have 1430 hours in this god-forsaken game. However, I must give everyone a warning who may consider purchasing this soul-sucking monstrosity.

For the first 200 hours or so, it's great fun. You either stab or get stabbed and it seems to get better as you go on, right? Wrong. It's too late. You've fallen into their trap with no way to escape the fog. Even death is not an escape. 

At 500 hours I started screaming every time I went outside and saw a crow. After 600, I ran away from every tall white man out of fear that I would get grabbed by the throat and brutally stabbed. 800 hours marked the avoidance of hospitals due to the possibility of sadistic doctors and teleporting nurses. After 1000, I would instinctively hide behind bushes in public and complain about the lack of pallets. Now, I no longer sleep. I live and breathe in the fog. There is no escape. Heed my warning. Save yourself. 

If not, I'll see you in the fog, you little self-hating masochist.

I've played this game on and off since it's release, and it holds a special place in my heart. Have made a lot of friends on it and it offers a genuinely unique form of gameplay you aren't going to find in other games. Not to mention the killers that are offered let you play as some really cool characters (I love the Demogorgon.) That being said, I've lost the motivation to play this game within the 5 or so months for a multitude of reasons, most of which being the game isn't that fun anymore. Coupled with somewhat incompetent developers, the game feels a bit lifeless nowadays.

I mostly played killer, was just the role I enjoyed more. It eventually got to a point though where I was forced to sweat most matches to get a win, and I don't really enjoy not having fun most matches. This is mostly a personal issue, because different people are going to be able to lose with more grace, but I don't personally enjoy the gameplay nessecarily without any payoff. A lot of matches will end with 8 hooks and no kills, and it gets repetitive being T-bagged and insulted at the end of almost every match. So I'm not really the best killer, and when book totems and other (in my opinion) unnessecary buffs were added to survivor, I kind of just dropped the game. I understand the whole "Just get better lawl" argument, but I've played this game for a long time, and I just don't feel like putting myself through a bunch of un-fun and extremely frusterating matches just to "get good."

So, if you're someone who isn't competitive, and is ok with losing for hours and hours on end, on the basis that it will "make you better", then I would recommend the game. Not saying you're bad at games, but this is one of those games that will take a lot of work to get into. Do be warned though, past the personal frustrations are genuine issue's with game development. Don't expect meaningful or helpful patches that balance the game, or make it funner for both sides. It's a pretty shared sentiment in the community that they don't really understand the mechanics of their own game.

This game literally makes me want to end my life. Why I still play it? Because it's Dead by Daylight. Which is probably what I will be soon if I keep playing this god damn game. Buy it, I guarantee you'll regret the decision.

Have fun with the countless awful hit boxes, the killers who will endlessly tunnel you for no reason and then tell you to "get gud" in endgame chat, the bullying and sandbagging by your idiotic team mates, and several glitches that will literally make you question your sanity! If you think you're sane before playing this game, wait until you get a few hundred hours in. I play this game daily, and each hour I play, contributes to yet another brain cell that I have lost because of this game. I want to die.
bad game
monkey balls very taste

I can never recommend this to anyone. The killers are so overpowered and the survivors are screwed over in every way possible.

There's literally an item that gives Myers an insta kill on someone who's been never been hooked or hurt. It's worse than a Mori and can be activated faster than one too. Every killer is some level of terrible. Be it PC huntress sniping you from a mile away or the deathslinger being able to shoot through objects.

Each change they make to the game just makes the killers more powerful. Be it the map designs blocking most of the windows and doorways, or creating dead ends everywhere, which would suck for anyone with memory issues. Or the survivors being able to get downed from several feet away due to bad hit boxes and a large hit radius on every killer. Not to mention charge attacks that carry them several feet forward. Also spamming to drop a pallet but somehow their hit goes through faster when your not even close to their weapon.

Also the quests favor killers too, prompting you to play them in order to gain any decent amount of blood points in a day.

The glitches are also a major issue, like a killer being able to launch themselves onto a hay bale that shouldn't be accessible at all, but sense they're coming at you with a chainsaw I guess it's fair right?

I've played killer and it's so easy to win that I just stopped killing players. I hate how over powered they are even when I play them. I can count on one hand how many times I've gotten screwed over as the killer, but I couldn't even count how many times being a survivor has ruined my entire day. One match can be so utterly unfair that it makes every survivor annoyed and stop playing. It's not fun. You get a handful of good moments in a session, but compared to just how many games you play and hate, it's just not worth it. I only ever play this game with friends at this point because I never want to go in solo knowing not only the killer will screw me, but the other survivors and map design and hit boxes will too. I can not see why anyone would play this alone, it would actively make me depressed and annoyed.

Most of my game sessions consist of me and my friends listing dozens of ways the game could be fixed to be balanced, but will any of it ever happen? No.

They tried to fix the wiggle mechanics, but that wasn't the issue. It's the fact that 3 hooks are next to you at all time and getting away is always next to impossible. And even if you can get away they can just down you again in the next 10-30 seconds because they know exactly where you're going.

You can never be prepared for a specific killer because it's random, but they can always be prepared for you. This game is just so killer thirsty that playing survivor feels like masochism at this point. 7 times out of 10 at least half your team will die unless it's just a lucky day or the killer just lets you live. It's just sad when a game session's biggest joke is how they always simp for the same person on your team and let's them live after brutally killing you and everyone else. I sometimes feel like the game plays into favoring user names or skins and promotes discriminating against certain people because of how they look. Not to mention if you offend a killer by surviving they'll just down you later and camp your body until you're dead.

So yeah, I just can not ever recommend this game because of just how flawed it is. Which is just so sad because of how great it could have been.

Esse jogo tem mts problemas, os devs não ouvem a comunidade, mapas muito desequilibrados e killers com niveis de poder muito distintos. Mesmo assim eu amo o jogo e não pretendo parar de jogar.
Se voce gosta de terror tem que jogar esse jogo, tem icones do genero como o maioral Pinhead, Ghostface e muito mais vindo, jogar de survivor é algo unico que não se encontra jogabilidade parecida em quase nenhum jogo, já jogar de killer é unico igual, porem cada um tem poderes diferentes que te fazem amar uns killers e odiar outros, diferente de outros jogos em que os poderes mudam pouco a jogabilidade.
Se voce decidir não jogar um jogo em especifico por nao gostar do genero, não tente aplicar isso ao dbd, é um jogo unico e barbarizante que não tem igual. Nota 9/10 (só pela incompetencia de certos desenvolvedores...).
chill n play i say :)
Funny how it went from fear to fun to frustration at times. All the Fs to DBD but it's still one love <3

Xeрня.

Le concept du jeu est bien foutu : 4 Survivants qui doivent s'échapper et un tueur qui... doit les éliminer.
Le gros point noir de ce jeu pour ma part c'est une bonne partie de la communauté (heureusement pas tous) qui est putain de toxic...

Je vais pas beaucoup discuter du point de vu survivant, on est tous d'accord : tunneling camp face c'est de la merde. Mais j'y reviendrai vite. Si vous jouez survivant solo, vous avez plusieurs options : Soit vous êtes avec des mates qui jouent le jeu et la survie (venir vous secourir, bait le tueur, faire les objectifs, etc), soit vous allez tomber avec des gens qui en ont rien à foutre / vont déco dès qu'ils se font taper, et la votre game est très compliquée voir foutue pour la déco.

Côté tueur, il faut s'équiper d'un mental d'acier si vous débutez ou que vous souhaitez apprendre le gameplay ^^ Pourtant je kiff le principe : courser les survivants, les frapper, mettre les survivants aux crochets, péter les gen, aucun soucis le concept est plutôt sympa, mais une ENORME partie des survivants que j'ai affronté sont putain de toxic omg calmez vous : c'est un JEU. Pas besoin de chier à la gueule du tueur s'il est pas forcément bon ou de tibag à la moindre palette parce que lol dans ta gueule grosse merde. J'ai déjà joué sur des jeux ou dans les commu y'a forcément son lot de toxic, mais sur DbD en tueur, facile 7 games sur 10 y'a des gens toxic qui vous insulte dans le lobby. Les gens ont oubliés qu'ils sont sur un jeu, et le respect est resté sur le côté du bureau. Je parlerai pas du GenRush que vous allez vous prendre dans la gueule, en plus des tibag et des taunts récurent. Un réel plaisir.

En tueur, j'me suis toujours dis "je tunnel pas, je camp pas, on joue fair". Ce que j'ai fais sur les débuts de game. Mais en montant dans les rangs, on s'aperçoit très vite que si le mental craque parce qu'un mec vous a troll toute la game, on oublie vite ces principes et ça part en camping face sur le trolleur. 

En parlant avec des joueurs, souvent ce qui me revient c'est "il manque des tueurs". En même temps, à force de tomber sur ce genre de joueurs, je comprends pourquoi une bonne partie des gens se barrent. Et c'est ces joueurs toxic qui après iront pleurer qu'ils n'y a plus personne, mais posez vous les bonnes questions ? no ?

Pour finir, je recommande pas ce jeu (ni d'investir) si vous n'avez pas un mental d'acier, ou si vous cherchez du fun en solo, vous allez être déçu. Oui, vous aurez de bonnes games de tant à autres, mais ça sera moindre que vos games ou les gens vous chieront à la gueule.
Cependant, je vous le recommande si vous jouez avec vos potes, ça peut donner des parties très funs entres copains ^^.
